name: Reduction of Radial Head Subluxation in Children Via a Nurse Initiated Pathway: A Clustered Randomized Control Trial

creator.name: Barrowman, Nick
creator.affiliation: Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute

creator.name: Correll, Rhonda
creator.affiliation: Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute

creator.name: Clarkin, Chantalle
creator.affiliation: Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute

author.name: Barrowman, Nick
author.affiliation: Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute

author.name: Correll, Rhonda
author.affiliation: Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute

author.name: Clarkin, Chantalle
author.affiliation: Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute

description: The study's objective was to examine whether triage nurses, trained in the use of a medical directive that taught recognition and treatment of radial head subluxation, could successfully reduce radial head subluxation at a rate similar to physicians. Given the practical constraints at the time of emergency department triage, this study was designed as a cluster randomized trial where the unit of randomization was a day and the patients on any given day were assigned to the nurse or physician arm for the entire day.

citation.text: Dixon A, Clarkin C, Barrowman N, Correll R, Osmond MH, Plint AC. Reduction of radial-head subluxation in children by triage nurses in the emergency department: a cluster-randomized controlled trial. CMAJ: Canadian Medical Association Journal. 2014;186(9): E317-E323.

funder.name: Ontario Ministry of Health and Long Term Care; Phase III Academic Health Science Centre/Alternate Funding Plan Innovation Fund

distribution.name: Dixon_Elbow_MD_data_form.doc
distribution.description: This form was used by physicians to record their level of training, time, method and outcome of each reduction attempt, as well as time of normal arm usage.

distribution.name: Dixon_Elbow_ Nurse_data_form.doc
distribution.description: This form was used by nurses to record the time of the reduction attempt, outcome (success/failure), and time of normal arm usage for each reduction attempt. If the patient used the arm normally the physician then recorded their discharge assessment. If the patient did not use their arm normally, the physician recorded their training level, time, method, and outcome (success/failure) of each reduction attempt as well as time of normal arm usage.

distribution.name: Dixon_Elbow_RA_data_collection_ form.doc
distribution.description: This form was used by study personnel to collect data about triage time, gender, discharge date, discharge time, discharge diagnosis, discharge treatment, and follow-up arrangements.
